aleena.name: Aleena
specialAbilities: Aleena begin the game with 1 rank in Coordination
Aleena are smaller than average, and count as silhouette 0
Sturdy Frame: Aleena begin the game with 1 rank in the Durable talent

anx.name: Anx
specialAbilities: Anx begin the game with 1 rank in the Kill With Kindness talent

Anatomical Knowledge: Anx have an innate grasp of how bodies are put together and are able to intuit the anatomical vulnerabilities of almost any species. Anx begin the game with 1 rank in the Lethal Blows talent
Mood Indicator: If an Anx's head-crest is not covered, they upgrade the difficulty of Deception checks once.

aqualish.name: Aqualish
specialAbilities: All Aqualish are capable of breathing underwater.
Aqualish begin the game with 1 rank in Brawl.
A player choosing to play an Aqualish character must choose one of the following sub-species:
Aquala: Aquala begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience. Furthermore, Aquala may remove 1 setback die imposed due to any cold or wet conditions from all skill checks.

Ualaq: Ualaq begin the game with 1 rank in Survival or 1 rank in Perception. Furthermore, Ualaq may remove 1 setback die imposed due to dark conditions, but suffer 1 setback die to all Perception checks in brightly lit environments.
Quara: Quara begin the game with 1 rank in Athletics or 1 rank in Coercion. Furthermore, Quara may remove 1 setback die when attempting to track anything through a natural environment.

arcona.name: Arcona
specialAbilities: Arcona begin the game with 1 rank in Vigilance.
When making skill checks, Arcona may remove 1 setback die imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.
Arcona add advantage to any Charm or Negotiation checks they make.

arkanian.name: Arkanian
specialAbilities: Arkanians begin the game with 1 rank in Medicine
Dark Vision: When making skill checks, Arkanians remove up to 2 Setback imposed due to darkness

balosar.name: Balosar
specialAbilities: Balosars begin the game with 1 rank in Streetwise.
Balosars add 2 Advantage to all Vigilance checks

bardottan.name: Bardottan
specialAbilities: Bardottans begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Lore)

besalisk.name: Besalisk
specialAbilities: Besalisk begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience
Additional Limbs: Besalisk have multiple sets of arms. As a result, they gain an additional free maneuver per turn. They may not perform more than 2 maneuvers per turn

bith.name: Bith
specialAbilities: Bith begin the game with 1 rank in Perception.

Bith add 1 boost die whenever they make a hearing-based Perception check. When Bith suffer strain due to loud noises, they suffer twice the normal amount of strain. Wearing ear protection negates both effects of this ability.

bothan.name: Bothan
specialAbilities: Bothans begin the game with 1 rank in Streetwise.
Bothans begin the game with 1 rank in the Convincing Demeanor talent

caamasi.name: Caamasi
specialAbilities: Caamasi begin the game with 1 rank in either Charm or Discipline.

Memnis: Once per game session, a Caamasi may form a new memnis that encompasses one scene or encounter. At any time, a Caamasi may perfectly recall any memnis that he has formed or witnessed, or share it with another Caamasi or a Force-sensitive character.

cerean.name: Cerean
specialAbilities: Cereans begin the game with 1 rank in Vigilance.
Cereans treat all Knowledge skills as career skills.

chadrafan.name: Chadra-Fan
specialAbilities: Chadra-Fan are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.
Chadra-Fan begin the game with 1 rank in Mechanics.
Chadra-Fan remove up to 2 setback die from their Perception checks.

chagrian.name: Chagrian
specialAbilities: Chagrians begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience.
Chagrians start with 1 rank in the Knowledge Specialization talent.
Chagrians can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

chevin.name: Chevin
specialAbilities: Chevin begin the game with 1 rank in Negotiation.
Chevin add 1 boost die to all Perception checks involving the sense of smell.
A Chevin's hide is thick and tough enough to absorb some damage, so they start the game with one rank in the Durable talent.

chiss.name: Chiss
specialAbilities: Chiss begin the game with 1 rank in Cool.
Chiss have adapted to be able to see in both the infrared and normal visual spectra. This enables Chiss characters to remove up to 1 setback die added to checks by lighting conditions.

clawdite.name: Clawdite
specialAbilities: Clawdite begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience

Changeling: AS an action, a Clawdite may suffer 3 strain to make an Average (2) Resilience check. On a success, the character changes their appearance to match that of a silhouette 1 character whom they have seen before. An observing character must make an opposed Perception vs Deception check to detect that something in amiss with the impersonated characters likeness, mannerisms, or behaviour.

cosian.name: Cosian
specialAbilities: Cosians begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Lore)
Strong Backed: All Cosians have an encumbrance threshold of 10 + Brawn

devaronian.name: Devaronian
specialAbilities: Devaronians begin the game with 1 rank in Survival or Deception
Devaronian physiology is naturally hardy and resistant to toxins. Members of that species add 1 Success to all Resilience checks they make

dowutin.name: Dowutin
specialAbilities: Dowutins begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience
Large: Dowutins may have a silhouette of 1 or 2, chosen at character creation

Immovable: Dowutins who suffer the immobilized condition, are knocked prone, or are otherwise moved against their will, may suffer 3 strain (or 1 with a silhouette of 2) to perform an out of turn incidental to ignore the effect

drabatan.name: Drabatan
specialAbilities: Drabatan begin the game with 1 rank in Charm or Leadership

Big Noise: When making a Leadership or Coercion check, Drabatan can spend 2 Advantage to affect 1 additional character not originally targeted by the check, or affect targets at 1 range band further than normal

drall.name: Drall
specialAbilities: Drall begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Education)
Drall have a mind for problems and solutions. Drall add 1 Boost in addition to using their skill or characteristic when providing assistance to a skill check

dressellian.name: Dressellian
specialAbilities: Dressellians begin the game with 1 rank in Survival.

Dressellians upgrade the difficulty of any checks involving advanced technology. This counts as any technology not available on the Dressellian's home planet, though individual pieces of technology they become familiar with over an extended period of time can become exempt from this at the GM's discretion. Dressellians can spend 10 XP at character creation to remove this penalty permanently.

droid.name: Droid
specialAbilities: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breathe, and are unaffected by toxins and poisons.
Droids have a cybernetic implant cap of 6 instead of their Brawn rating.

Droid Player Characters may train one rank each in six of the eight career skills (instead of the usual four). After selecting a specialization, a droid PC may train one rank each in three of the four specialization skills (instead of the usual two).

Since droids are inorganic, they do not gain the benefits of recovering with a bacta tank, a stimpack, or Medicine skill checks. Droids do recover naturally by resting, as their systems attempt self-repairs. If self-repair is not ade-quately effective, a droid needs to be tended to with a Mechanics check, using the same difficul-ties and results as Medicine checks for organic beings. Emergency repair patches can be used to repair damage, just like stimpacks can be used on organic beings. See page 232 for more on droid repairs and healing.
Droids begin the game with 1 rank in the Enduring talent.
Droids cannot become Force-sensitive nor acquire a Force rating by any means. Droids cannot use Force powers and also cannot be affected by mind-altering Force powers.

dug.name: Dug
specialAbilities: Dug begin the game with 1 rank in Brawl
Born to Ride: Whether it be atop dangerous beasts, or screaming repulsor, Dugs are particularly adept riders. They begin the game with 1 rank of the Defensive Driving talent

duros.name: Duros
specialAbilities: Duros begin the game with one rank in Piloting (Space).
Duros may add advantage to all Astrogation checks they make.

elom.name: Elom
specialAbilities: Eloms begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience.

Before using a maneuver to move, an Elom may spend a maneuver to dig, allowing the Elom to use that move maneuver to travel through loose soil or similar terrain. At the Game Master's discretion, this excavation can result in a low, narrow tunnel that others can use.

elomin.name: Elomin
specialAbilities: Elomin begin the game with 1 rank in Charm
Elomin begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Education).

falleen.name: Falleen
specialAbilities: Falleen begin the game with 1 rank in Charm.

By emitting pheromones and altering their skin colour, Falleen can affect emotional states of other sentients. Once per check as an incidental, a Falleen may suffer 2 strain to upgrade the ability of a Charm, Deception or Negotiation check against a living sentient being within short range once. This ability has no effect on targets wearing breath masks or without respiratory systems.

gand.name: Gand
specialAbilities: Gands begin the game with 1 rank in Discipline.
Subspecies: In Character creation, choose one of the following sub species of Gand.
Lungs: These Gands breate an ammonia gas mixture. They begin the game with an ammonia respirator, and treat oxygen as a dangerous atmosphere with Rating 8. They gain an additional 10 starting XP.
No Lungs: These Those Gand do not respire, and gain all necessary metabolic substances through food. They are immune to suffocation (But not vacuums.)

gank.name: Gank
specialAbilities: Ganks begin the game with 1 rank in Coercion or Vigilance.

All Ganks are cyborgs and each one often possesses several different cybernetic implants. A Gank begins play with up to two cybernetics (such as those on page 173 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook or on page 106 of this book) that cost a total of up to 5,000 credits. If a character takes on additional obligation for credits at character creation, he may apply these extra funds to the 5,000 credit budget to purchase cybernetics. Ganks have a cybernetic implant cap of 3 plus Brawn rating.

gigorian.name: Gigorian
specialAbilities: Gigorian begin the game with 1 rank in Brawl
Gigorian remove 1 Setback imposed due to cold or snow filled conditions from any checks
Gigorians upgrade the difficulty of Mechanics checks involving advanced technology once

gossam.name: Gossam
specialAbilities: Gossams begin the game with 1 rank in Deception.
Gossams are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

gotal.name: Gotal
specialAbilities: Gotals begin the game with 1 rank in Perception.

The head cones of a Gotal are finely tuned sensory organs used to detect almost the entirety of the electromagnetic spectrum. Once per encounter as a maneuver, a Gotal may sense the presence and current emotional states of all living things within short range of himself.

gran.name: Gran
specialAbilities: Gran begin the game with 1 rank in Charm or Negotiation.
When making ranged combat or Perception checks, Gran remove up to 2 Setback Die imposed due to environmental conditions or concealment.

gungan.name: Gungan
specialAbilities: Gungans begin the game with 1 rank in Athletics
Amphibious: Gungans may breathe underwater without penalty an don't suffer movement penalties for travelling through water

human.name: Human
specialAbilities: Humans begin the game with 1 rank in 2 different non-career skills of your choice

humanC.name: Corellian Humans
specialAbilities: Corellians begin the game with 1 rank in Piloting (Space) or (Planetary)
Because Corellians are naturally exceptional pilots and grow up handling swoops, airspeeders, and spacecraft from a young age, they may train Piloting up to rank 3 during character creation

hutt.name: Hutt
specialAbilities: Hutts begin the game with 1 rank in the Enduring and Nobody's Fool talents.
Hutts begin the game with 1 rank in Coercion or Discipline.
A Hutt can never spend more than one maneuver moving per turn.

iakaru.name: Iakaru
specialAbilities: Iakaru begin the game with 1 rank in Piloting (Space)
Iakaru suffer no terrain penalties to move through jungles, or similar environments. They also add 1 Boost to Athletics and Coordination checks related to climbing, swinging, and balancing

iktotchi.name: Iktotchi
specialAbilities: Iktotchi begin the game with 1 rank in Vigilance

Precognition: Iktotchi occasionally see glimpses of the future, letting them predict certain events even before they occur. In addition to seeing flashes of the future, Iktotchi may spend 1 Triumph on a check to determine initiative order to perform a free maneuver before the encounter begins, or to have an ally in short range perform a free maneuver.

ishiTib.name: Ishi Tib
specialAbilities: Ishi Tib begin the game with 1 rank in Discipline.
Ishi Tib can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.
If an Ishi Tib has not been doused in salt water in the last 24 hours the character's wound threshold is reduced by 2. The condition remains in effect until the Ishi Tib is doused in salt water.

ithorian.name: Ithorian
specialAbilities: Ithorians begin the game with 1 rank in Survival.
Roar: (Resilience; Damage 6; Critical 4; Range [Short]; Blast 3, Con-cussive 1, Slow-Firing 2, Stun Damage). Each time the Ithorian uses this ability, he suffers 3 strain.

kalleran.name: Kalleran
specialAbilities: Kallerans begin the game with 1 rank in Streetwise
Hypersensitive Antennae: Kallerans begin the game with the Heightened Awareness talent

kaminoan.name: Kaminoan
specialAbilities: Kaminoans begin the game with 1 rank in Medicine.
Kaminoans begin the game with 1 rank in the Researcher talent.
Kaminoans add 1 setback to all Charm checks they make. Other characters add 1 setback to all social skill checks they make when targeting Kaminoans.

keldor.name: Kel'Dor
specialAbilities: Kel'Dors begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Education).
Kel'Dors may remove up to 2 Setback die imposed due to darkness from all skill checks.
Kel'Dors begin the game with an antitox breath mask
Kel'Dors treat oxygen as a dangerous atmosphere with Rating 8.
Kel'Dors may survive in vacuum for up to five minutes before suffering its effects.

klatooinian.name: Klatooinian
specialAbilities: Klatooinians begin the game with 1 rank in Brawl or Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light).
Klatooinians begin the game with 1 additional rank of one non-career skill of his choice.

kubaz.name: Kubaz
specialAbilities: Kubaz begin the game with 1 rank in Stealth or Survival.
When making Ranged combat, or Perception checks, Kubaz may remove up to 2 Setback imposed due to concealment or applicable environmental factors (but not defense)

kyuzo.name: Kyuzo
specialAbilities: Kyuzo begin the game with 1 rank in Coordination.

Kyuzo are adapted for Phatrong's relatively high gravity, and can make impressive bounding leaps on most other worlds. Once per round as a maneuver, a Kyuzo may suffer 3 strain to leap horizontally or vertically to any location within medium range.

lannik.name: Lannik
specialAbilities: Lanniks begin the game with 1 rank in Streetwise.
Indomitable: A Lannik removes up to 2 setback die caused by Critical Injuries, fear or the disoriented condition from all checks.

melitto.name: Melitto
specialAbilities: Melittos begin the game with 1 rank in Perception.
Melittos can perceive their surroundings without needing light, and never suffer penalties to combat or Perception due to darkness, or other environmental factors that affect vision

Melittos require the toxins of their native atmosphere to live; off world, they gain free special respirators to emulate the conditions of their homeworld. They treat standard planetary air composition as a corrosive atmosphere with a rating of 6

mikkian.name: Mikkian
specialAbilities: Mikkians begin the game with 1 rank in Discipline
Sensory Tendrils: Mikkians add 1 Boost to all Perception checks they make

mirialan.name: Mirialan
specialAbilities: Mirialans begin the game with 1 rank in Discipline
Mirialans begin the game with 1 rank in Cool

monCalamari.name: Mon Calamari
specialAbilities: Mon Calamari begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Education).
Mon Calamari can breathe under-water without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

mustafarianN.name: Mustafarian (Northern)
specialAbilities: Northern Mustafarians may remove 2 Setback from checks to resist arid or hot environmental conditions
Northern Mustafarian begin the game with 1 rank in the Eye For Detail talent

mustafarianS.name: Mustafarian (Southern)
specialAbilities: Southern Mustafarians may remove 2 Setback from checks to resist arid or hot environmental conditions
Southern Mustafarians begin the game with 1 rank in the Enduring talent

muun.name: Muun
specialAbilities: Muun begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Core) and (Education)
Deep Pockets: Muun Characters begin the game with an additional 1000 Credits (they may not spend these credits during character creation)

nautolan.name: Nautolan
specialAbilities: Nautolans begin the game with 1 rank in Athletics.
Nautolans may breathe underwa­ter without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

neimoidian.name: Neimoidian
specialAbilities: Neimoidians begin the game with 1 rank in either Deception or Negotiation.

nikto.name: Nikto
specialAbilities: Each Nikto subspecies has its own special abilities, listed here.
Kajain'sa'Niktos: (Red) Red Niktos begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience. When making skill checks, Red Niktos may remove 1 setback die imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.

Kadas'sa'Niktos: (Green) Green Niktos begin the game with 1 rank in Coordination. They also gain 1 boost die to all Athletics checks made to climb trees and other surfaces their claws can pierce. When a Green Nikto makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, he deals +1 damage and has a Critical Rating of 3.

Esral'sa'Niktos: (Mountain) Mountain Niktos begin the game with 1 rank in Survival. They also gain the Natural Outdoorsman talent (once per game session, a Mountain Nikto may reroll any one Resilience or Survival check.

Gluss'Sa'Niktos: (Pale) Pale Niktos begin the game with 1 rank in Athletics. A Pale Nikto suffers no movement penalties for traveling through water and can hold their breath for a number of rounds equal to twice their Brawn rating before beginning to drown.
M'Shento'Su'Niktos (Southern) Southern Niktos begin the game with 1 rank in Perception. Southern Niktos may add 1 boost die to all Perception and Vigilance checks to detect sounds.

pantoran.name: Pantoran
specialAbilities: Pantorans begin the game with 1 rank in Cool or Negotiation
Tundra Dwellers: Pantorans remove 1 Setback imposed due to cold environmental conditions from all skill checks

pauan.name: Pau'an
specialAbilities: Pau'ans begin the game with 1 rank in Negotiation or Coercion

Sensitive Hearing: Pau'an's add 1 Boost to all Perception and Vigilance checks they make as long as they are wearing their protective earpieces. If they are not, they do not gain this bonus and instead add 1 Threat to Perception and Vigilance checks they make
All Pau'ans begin the game with a protective earpiece

phylodon.name: Phylodon
specialAbilities: Phylodons begin the game with 1 rank in Cool or Discipline

Symbiotic Resilience: When recovering wounds naturally, Phylodons heal 1 additional wound per full nights rest. In addition, a Phylodon may attempt to recover naturally from 1 Critical Injury after a full nights rest, rather than a weeks rest
Symbiont Isolation: If no other Phylodons are present when a Phylodon recovers strain at the end of an encounter, they recover 1 less strain to a minimum of 1

polisMassan.name: Polis Massan
specialAbilities: Polis Massans begin the game with 1 rank in Medicine.

The vast majority of Polis Massans are born without vocal chords, though a small subset does possess them. Referred to as ‘‘speakers’’ by their people, these rare individuals can physically speak languages, though their voices are soft and strangely resonant. When creating a Polis Massan character, a player may spend 10 starting XP to specify that the character possesses vocal chords.

Polis Massans can communicate with other beings at short range using a simple form of telepathy. This communication is akin to a broadcast, and anyone within short range ‘‘hears’’ the Polis Massans speech. Polis Massans can only 'whisper' privately to beings they are engaged with.

quarren.name: Quarren
specialAbilities: Quarren begin the game with 1 rank in Negotiation.
Quarren can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Quarren can spit ink from a specialized sac within their gills that disperses in water, creating a brief murk used to confuse foes or escape predators. This ability can be used on land as well, though it is considerably less effective because it must be sprayed directly on the target. Once per encounter, as an out-of-turn incidental, a Quarren may suffer 2 strain to add 1 setback die to a combat check made by a character within short range (underwater, it adds 3 setback die to the combat check instead).

quermian.name: Quermian
specialAbilities: Quermians begin the game with 1 rank in Perception
Additional Limbs: Quermians have 6 limbs, 2 legs and 4 arms. As a result they gain and additional free maneuver per turn, although they still may not perform more than 2 maneuvers per turn

rodian.name: Rodian
specialAbilities: Rodians begin the game with 1 rank in Survival.
Rodians begin the game with 1 rank in the Expert Tracker talent.

sakiyan.name: Sakiyan
specialAbilities: Sakiyans begin the game with 1 rank in Perception or Vigilance.
Sakiyans begin the game with 1 rank in the Expert Tracker talent.

selonian.name: Selonian
specialAbilities: Selonians begin the game with 1 rank in Coordination
The structure of a Selonian's eyes allow them to see in near total darkness. They may remove all Setback added to checks due to darkness, though still cannot see in absolute darkness

Tail: A Selonian's tail may be used as a Brawl weapon with (Brawl; Damage: +1; Critical 5; Ranged [Engaged]; Disorient 2; Knockdown). They may trigger Knockdown using 1 Advantage, but still must spend additional Advantage to knockdown targets with a higher silhouette per the Knockdown rules

sathari.name: Sathari
specialAbilities: Sathari begin the game with 1 rank in Coordination
Glider: A Sathari can fall safely from any height, and can glide over small gaps or distances while falling. While concious, a Sathari character does not suffer damage from falling.

shistavanen.name: Shistavanen
specialAbilities: Shistavanens begin the game with 1 rank in either Brawl or Survival.
When making a check for initiative, a Shistavanen may make a Survival check instead of a Discipline or Cool check.

skakoan.name: Skakoan
specialAbilities: Skakoans begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Education).
Skakoans begin the game with 1 rank in Mechanics.

sullustan.name: Sullustan
specialAbilities: Sullustans begin the game with 1 rank in Astrogation.
Sullustans begin the game with 1 rank in the Skilled Jockey talent.

thisspiasian.name: Thisspiasian
specialAbilities: Thisspiasians begin the game with 1 rank in Discipline

Rest and Meditation: Thisspiasians need very little sleep to function. They only need to sleep for 2 hours to heal all strain they are suffering from, instead of a full night. (They cannot sleep multiple times a day however). Once per session, a Thisspiasian may spend 10 mins meditating to heal strain equal to twice their ranks in Discipline

tholothian.name: Tholothian
specialAbilities: Tholothians begin the game with 1 rank in Knowledge (Xenology)
Cultural Adopters: Tholothians add 1 Advantage when making a social check to  interact with a non-Tholothian
Natural Roots: When making a check to heal strain while in a natural or wild setting, Tholothians heal 1 additional strain

tognath.name: Tognath
specialAbilities: Cybernetic implants and specialized lenses for their compound eyes grant Tognath 1 free rank in Coordination and Perception. This set of cybernetics counts as 1 implant against a Tognath's limit
Primitive Nerves: Add 2 Setback to Coercion checks targeting Tognath

Tognath must wear a specialised mask or breathing apparatus to breathe outside their native atmosphere. Tognath begin the game with a breath mask and treat oxygen as a corrosive atmosphere with Rating 5. However they can survive in a vacuum for up to 5 minutes before suffering its effects

togruta.name: Togruta
specialAbilities: Togrutas begin the game with 1 rank in Perception.
Togrutas grant 2 boost die when performaning assist maneuvers, instead of 1.

toydarian.name: Toydarian
specialAbilities: Toydarians are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

Toydarians have wings that allow them to hover slightly off of the ground. When hovering, Toydarians do not have to spend additional maneuvers when navigating difficult terrain. Otherwise, their wings allow them no extra capabilities beyond those of a normal, walking character.

trandoshan.name: Trandoshan
specialAbilities: Trandoshans begin the game with 1 rank in Perception

Regeneration: Whenever a Trandoshan would recover 1 or more wounds from natural rest or recuperation in a Bacta Tank, they recover 1 additional wound. They do not recover additional wounds when receiving first aid or medical treatment, or when using a stimpack. Trandoshans can regrow lost limbs, but the process usually takes at least a month before the limb is usable.
Claws: When a Trandoshan makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, they deal +1 damage and have a crit rating of 3.

twilek.name: Twi'lek
specialAbilities: Twi'leks begin the game with 1 rank in either Charm or Deception.
Twi'leks may remove 1 setback imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions from all skill checks.

verpine.name: Verpine
specialAbilities: Verpine begin the game with 1 rank in Mechanics.
The compound eyes of a Verpine are capable of seeing tiny, even microscopic, details. When closely examining an object, Verpine characters add 1 boost die to their Perception checks.
Verpine can produce and hear radio waves, which allows them to silently communicate with other Verpine and specially tuned comlinks within a 100-kilometer range.

vurk.name: Vurk
specialAbilities: Vurks begin the game with 1 rank in Negotiation
Amphibious: Vurks can breathe underwater without penalty, and suffer no movement penalties when travelling through water
Cold Blooded: Vurks add 1 Setback to all checks they make while in cold environments (In addition to other penalties)

weequay.name: Weequay
specialAbilities: Weequays begin the game with 1 rank in Resilience or Athletics.

A Weequay can communicate with other Weequays using pheromones. This is completely non-verbal, and undetectable to any other species nearby. Weequays can only communicate like this if they are within short range of each other.

whiphid.name: Whiphid
specialAbilities: Whiphids begin the game with 1 rank in Survival
Hardy Survivalist: A Whiphid adds 1 Success to all Sruvival checks, and can survive several weeks without food thanks to reserve blubbler
Tusks: When a Whiphid makes a Brawl check to deal damage to an opponent, they deal +2 damage, has a Critical Rating of 4, and the Vicious 1 quality

wookiee.name: Wookiee
specialAbilities: Wookiees begin the game with 1 rank in Brawl.
Wookies deal an extra 1 damage on all Brawl and Melee attacks while not at full wounds. If they suffer from a Critical Injury, they deal an extra 2 damage instead.

xexto.name: Xexto
specialAbilities: Xexto begin the game with 1 rank in the Confidence talent.
Xexto have six limbs: two legs and four arms. As a result, they gain an additional free maneuver per turn, though they still may not perform more than two maneuvers per turn.

zabrak.name: Zabrak
specialAbilities: Zabrak begin the game with 1 rank in Survival.
Zabrak add 1 advantage to all Coercion checks they make.

aStepAhead.description: Once per session, you may suffer 2 strain in order to count your Cunning as 1 higher than normal for the remainder of the encounter
aStepAhead.name: A Step Ahead

adversary.description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary
adversary.name: Adversary

allTerrainDriver.description: Do not suffer the usual penalties for driving through difficult terrain using Piloting (Planetary)
allTerrainDriver.name: All-Terrain Driver

alteredDeal.description: Once per session, you may make an Altered Deal action; Make a Hard (3) Coercion check to radically change a previously made deal or bargain to your advantage
alteredDeal.name: Altered Deal

ambush.description: Once per round, while benefiting from cover, you make make the Ambush maneuver. Add damage equal to ranks in Stealth to one hit of the next successful combat check against a target in short range before the end of the turn
ambush.name: Ambush

analyzeData.description: Once per session, after capturing enemy data, you may perform an Analyze Data action; Make an Average (2) Knowledge (Warfare) check. Once, during the remainder of the session, you may add 1 Success per rank of Knowledge (Warfare) to one check related to that data
analyzeData.name: Analyze Data

anatomyLessons.description: After making a successful attack, you may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Intellect to one hit
anatomyLessons.name: Anatomy Lessons

armorMaster.description: When wearing armor, increase your total soak value by 1
armorMaster.name: Armor Master

asTheForceWillsIt.description: You may make an Easy (1) Knowledge (Lore) check to heal strain at the end of an encounter. 1 Triumph can be used to heal all strain.
asTheForceWillsIt.name: As The Force Wills It

bactaSpecialist.description: Patients heal 1 additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist when they recover wounds from bacta tanks or long term care.
bactaSpecialist.name: Bacta Specialist

badCop.description: You may spend 2 Advantage from a Deception or Coercion check to upgrade the ability of an ally's subsequent social interaction against that target a number of times equal to ranks in Bad Cop
badCop.name: Bad Cop

badMotivator.description: Once per session, you may take a Bad Motivator action; Make a Hard (3) Mechanics check to cause one targeted device to spontaneously fail.
badMotivator.name: Bad Motivator

badPress.description: Once per session, you may choose an organization and make a Hard (3) Deception check. On success, organization members have their wound thresholds reduced by 1, plus an additional 1 per 3 success. This lasts until the end of the session
badPress.name: Bad Press

balance.description: When you heal strain at the end of an encounter, you you may add extra Force Die up to your Force Rating. You recover additional strain equal to (Force Point) generated)
balance.name: Balance

barrage.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of a successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.
barrage.name: Barrage

basicCombatTraining.description: Brawl and Ranged (Light) become career skills
basicCombatTraining.name: Basic Combat Training

beastWrangler.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Beast Wrangler to checks to tame or wrangle creatures.
beastWrangler.name: Beast Wrangler

blackMarketContacts.description: When purchasing illegal goods, you may reduce the rarity by 1 per ranks of Black Market Contacts, increasing the cost by 50% of base cost per times reduced.
blackMarketContacts.name: Black Market Contacts

blackmail.description: When an NPC exceeds their strain threshold, you may spend 1 Destiny Point to convince that NPC to perform a single task before becoming incapacitated.
blackmail.name: Blackmail

blindSpot.description: This character, and allies within short range, add 1 Advantage to combat checks while benefiting from cover.
blindSpot.name: Blind Spot

blooded.description: Add 1 Boost die per rank of Blooded to all checks to resist or recover from poisons, venoms, or toxins. Reduce the duration of ongoing poisons by 1 round per rank of Blooded to a minimum of 1.
blooded.name: Blooded

bodyGuard.description: Once per round, perform the Body Guard maneuver to guard an engaged character. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Body Guard, then until the beginning of the next turn, upgrade the difficulty of combat checks targeting the character by that number.
bodyGuard.name: Body Guard

bolsteredArmor.description: Increase the armor value of your Signature Vehicle by 1 per rank of Bolstered Armor
bolsteredArmor.name: Bolstered Armor

boughtInfo.description: Instead of making a Knowledge check, you may take a Bought Info action; spend credits equal to 50 times the difficulty of the check to pass with 1 Success
boughtInfo.name: Bought Info

brace.description: As a maneuver, you may brace yourself. On your next action, you remove 1 setback die per rank of Brace. This can only remove a setback die added due to environmental circumstances
brace.name: Brace

brilliantEvasion.description: Once per encounter, you may take a Brilliant Evasion action. Select 1 opponent and make an opposed Piloting check to stop that opponent from attacking you for a number of rounds equal to your Agility score
brilliantEvasion.name: Brilliant Evasion

burly.description: Reduce any wielded weapon's Cumbersome quality and Encumbrance rating by ranks in Burly to a minimum of 1
burly.name: Burly

byTheBook.description: Once per encounter, before making a combat check, you may suffer 2 strain to add 1 Advantage per ranks in By The Book to combat checks
byTheBook.name: By The Book

bypassSecurity.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Bypass Security from all checks to disable a security door or open a locked door.
bypassSecurity.name: Bypass Security

calmCommander.description: You may use ranks in Cool to upgrade Mass Combat checks instead of ranks in Leadership
calmCommander.name: Calm Commander

carefulPlanning.description: Once per session, you may introduce a "fact" to the narrative as if a Destiny Point had been spent
carefulPlanning.name: Careful Planning

cleverCommander.description: You may use ranks in Knowledge (Warfare) to upgrade Mass Combat checks instead of ranks in Leadership
cleverCommander.name: Clever Commander

cleverSolution.description: Once per session, you may make 1 skill check using Cunning, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill
cleverSolution.name: Clever Solution

codebreaker.description: Remove 1 setback per rank of Codebreaker from all checks to break codes or decrypt communications. Decrease the difficulty of all checks to break codes or decrypt communications by 1.
codebreaker.name: Codebreaker

combatProgramming.description: Once per encounter, you make make a Hard (3) Computers check while repairing or working on a droid. For the remainder of the encounter, the droid gains 1 rank in 2 different combat skills.
combatProgramming.name: Combat Programming

combatVeteran.description: you add 1 Boost to all Brawl and Discipline checks equal to your ranks in Combat Veteran
combatVeteran.name: Combat Veteran

command.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Command when making Leadership checks. Affected targets add 1 Boost to Discipline checks for the next 24 hours.
command.name: Command

commandingPresence.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Commanding Presence from Leadership and Cool checks
commandingPresence.name: Commanding Presence

comradesInArms.description: Once per encounter, you may take a Comrades In Arms action; Make a hard (3) Discipline check. If successful, you plus an additional ally per uncancelled success within medium range gain +1 Defense for the remainder of the encounter
comradesInArms.name: Comrades In Arms

conditioned.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Conditioned from Athletics and Coordination checks. Reduce the damage and strain suffered by 1 per rank of Conditioned
conditioned.name: Conditioned

confidence.description: You may decrease the difficulty of all Discipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence
confidence.name: Confidence

constantVigilance.description: You may always use Vigilance when making checks to determine initiative
constantVigilance.name: Constant Vigilance

constructionSpecilist.description: Remove 1 Setback equal to ranks in Construction Specialist from all checks to construct defenses, positions, and similar projects
constructionSpecilist.name: Construction Specialist

contingencyPlan.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to your Cunning Rating
contingencyPlan.name: Contingency Plan

contraption.description: Once per session, you may take a Contraption action; Make a Hard (3) Mechanics check to fashion a device to solve a current problem using just the tools and parts on hand.
contraption.name: Contraption

convincingDemeanor.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Convincing Demeanor from all Deception and Skulduggery checks.
convincingDemeanor.name: Convincing Demeanor

coordinatedAssault.description: Take the Coordinated Assault maneuver; a number of engaged allies equal to your ranks in Leadership add 1 Advantage to all combat checks until the beginning of the next turn. Range increases per ranks in Coordinated Assault
coordinatedAssault.name: Coordinated Assault

corellianSendoff.description: You may take a Corellian Sendoff action, targeting 2 ships or vehicles at Close range; Make a Hard (3) Cool check to cause the targets to suffer a minor collision.
corellianSendoff.name: Corellian Sendoff

creativeDesign.description: As part of resolving a successful crafting check, you may also apply a result equivalent to spending a number of Advantage equal to ranks in Creative Design. The GM may then apply a result equivalent to spending that many Threat.
creativeDesign.name: Creative Design

creativeKiller.description: Reduce the crit rating of improvised weapons by 2 (to a minimum of 1)
creativeKiller.name: Creative Killer

cripplingBlow.description: Increase the difficulty of the next combat check by 1. If that check deals damage, the target suffers 1 strain whenever they move for the remainder of the encounter
cripplingBlow.name: Crippling Blow

cunningPersona.description: You may suffer 2 strain to make a Charm check using Cunning rather than Presence
cunningPersona.name: Cunning Persona

cunningSnare.description: Once per encounter, as an action, you may create a trap. Any other character who moves to engaged range of the trap must make an opposed Vigilance vs Survival check to avoid harm and ill effects.
cunningSnare.name: Cunning Snare

customizedCoolingUnit.description: Increase the system strain threshold of your Signature Vehicle by 2 per rank of Customized Cooling Unit
customizedCoolingUnit.name: Customized Cooling Unit

cuttingQuestion.description: Once per encounter, when making a Coercion check, you may use Deception instead.
cuttingQuestion.name: Cutting Question

deadToRights.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to half Agility (rounded up) to one hit of a successful attack made with a ship or vehicle mounted weapon.
deadToRights.name: Dead to Rights

deadlyAccuracy.description: Each time a rank of Deadly Accuracy is quired, pick one combat skill. You may add damage to one hit of a successful attack equal to ranks in the chosen skills
deadlyAccuracy.name: Deadly Accuracy

debilitatingShot.description: Upon a successful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, you may spend 2 Advantage to reduce the maximum speed of the target by 1 until the end of the next round
debilitatingShot.name: Debilitating Shot

dedication.description: When a rank in Dedication is aquired, gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring the characteristic above 6
dedication.name: Dedication

defensiveDriving.description: Increase the defense of the vehicle or starship being piloted by 1 per rank of Defensive Driving
defensiveDriving.name: Defensive Driving

defensiveSlicing.description: When defending a computer system, add 1 setback per rank of Defensive Slicing to opponents checks.
defensiveSlicing.name: Defensive Slicing

defensiveStance.description: Once per round, you may perform a Defensive Stance maneuver and suffer a number of strain up to your ranks in Defensive Stance to upgrade the difficulty of all incoming melee attacks by and equal amount
defensiveStance.name: Defensive Stance

designFlaw.description: When making a combat check with a personal scale weapon against a droid, you may add 1 Advantage per rank of Design Flaw
designFlaw.name: Design Flaw

desperateRepairs.description: Once per session, you may make a Hard (3) Mechanics check on one engaged allied droid. If successful, the droid becomes immobilized and staggered for 1 round, and then heals all strain and up to 1 Critical Injury with a severity rating no greater than Hard (3)
desperateRepairs.name: Desperate Repairs

discipleOfLore.description: Once per round, you may suffer 1 Strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Knowledge (Lore) check a number of times equal to ranks in Disciple Of Lore
discipleOfLore.name: Disciple Of Lore

disciplinedSoul.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point after making a Discipline cheack to spend a number of Threats up to ranks in Knowledge (Lore) as Advantage
disciplinedSoul.name: Disciplined Soul

discredit.description: Once per encounter, you may take the Discredit action; Make a Hard (3) Deception check to upgrade the difficulty of one characters social checks once, plus an additional time for ever 2 Advantage, until the end of the encounter.
discredit.name: Discredit

disorient.description: After a successful attack, you may spend 2 Advantage to disorient the target for a number of rounds equal to your ranks in Disorient
disorient.name: Disorient

disorientingStrike.description: After failing a Lightsaber combat check, ou may spend 2 Advantage, or 1 Triumph, to disorient the opponent for 3 rounds.
disorientingStrike.name: Disorienting Strike

dockyardExpertise.description: You may make an Average (2) Knowledge (Education) check when at a space dock. If successful, the cost and time for repairs is reduced by 20% per rank of Dockyard Expertise.
dockyardExpertise.name: Dockyard Expertise

dodge.description: When targeted by a combat check, you may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than your ranks in Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number
dodge.name: Dodge

doubleTalk.description: You may spend 2 Advantage, or 1 Triumph, from a successful Charm or Deception roll to disorient a number of opponents within short range equal to your Presence Rating for the remainder of the current round, and the next 2 rounds
doubleTalk.name: Double-Talk

durable.description: You may reduce any Critical Injury suffered by 10 per rank of Durable, to a minimum of 1
durable.name: Durable

dynamicFire.description: When making a ranged attack while engaged with an opponent, you may suffer 2 strain to reduce the ranged modifier by 1
dynamicFire.name: Dynamic Fire

encodedCommunique.description: Upgrade the difficulty of checks to decrypt your coded messages without the proper cipher a number of times equal to your Computers Skill
encodedCommunique.name: Encoded Communique

encouragingWords.description: After an ally within short range fails a check, you may suffer 1 Strain to assist their next check this encounter as an out of turn incidental
encouragingWords.name: Encouraging Words

exhaustPort.description: Before attacking a starship or vehicle, you may spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore the effects of the Massive rule for the attack
exhaustPort.name: Exhaust Port

exhaustiveQuestioning.description: Whenever you make a successful social check against a captured enemy within short range, you may reduce that enemies strain threshold by 2 for the remainder of the session. You can spend 1 Advantage to inflict 1 strain
exhaustiveQuestioning.name: Exhaustive Questioning

expertHandler.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Expert Handler from Survival checks made to ride beasts.
expertHandler.name: Expert Handler

expertTracker.description: Remove 1 setback die per rank of Expert Tracker from checks to find tracks, or track targets. Decrease time to track a target by half.
expertTracker.name: Expert Tracker

extendedReach.description: While armed with a two-handed melee weapon, you may suffer 1 strain to make a Melee combat check with that weapon targeting an enemy at short range, rather than engaged range
extendedReach.name: Extended Reach

eyeForDetail.description: After making a Mechanics or Computers check, you may suffer strain up to ranks in Eye For Detail to convert that many uncancelled Success into Advantage
eyeForDetail.name: Eye For Detail

familiarSuns.description: Once per session, you may perform a Familiar Suns maneuver; Make a Hard (3) Knowledge (Outer Rim) or (Core Worlds) check to reveal the current type of planetary environment, and other useful information.
familiarSuns.name: Familiar Suns

fancyPaintJob.description: Upgrade all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks made in the presence of Signature Vehicles once.
fancyPaintJob.name: Fancy Paint Job

fearsomeRep.description: Add 1 Advantage per rank of Fearsome Rep to the results of all Coercion checks
fearsomeRep.name: Fearsome Rep

feralStrength.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Feral Strength to one hit of a successful attack made using Brawl or Melee.
feralStrength.name: Feral Strength

fieldCommander.description: Take the Field Commander action; make an Average (2) Leadership check. A number of allies equal to your Presence Rating may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform 1 free maneuver.
fieldCommander.name: Field Commander

fineTuning.description: When reducing the amount of system strain a starship or vehicle suffers, reduce 1 additional strain per rank of Fine Tuning
fineTuning.name: Fine Tuning

fireControl.description: Take a Fire Control action; all combat checks made form the current starship or vehicle count their target's silhouette as 1 higher than normal until the beginning of the next turn. Does not stack.
fireControl.name: Fire Control

forager.description: Remove up to 2 setback die from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the normal time.
forager.name: Forager

forceOfWill.description: Once per session, you may make 1 skill check using Willpower rather than the characteristic linked to that skill
forceOfWill.name: Force Of Will

formOnMe.description: When you would perform a Gain The Advantage action in a starship/vehicle, a number of allied starships/vehicles within close range also gain the benefits from Gain The Advantage until they leave close range, or Gain The Advantage loses its effects
formOnMe.name: Form On Me

formationTactics.description: You may take a Formation Tactics action by making a Hard (3) Leadership check. If successful, you may choose a number of allies within short range equal to the number of uncancelled successes. Upgrade the difficulty of attacks against them until the end of your next turn
formationTactics.name: Formation Tactics

fortifiedVacuumSeal.description: Increase the hull trauma threshold of your Signature Vehicle by 1 per rank of Fortified Vacuum Seal
fortifiedVacuumSeal.name: Fortified Vacuum Seal

freerunning.description: Suffer 1 Strain when making a move maneuver to more to any location within short range
freerunning.name: Freerunning

frenziedAttack.description: When making a Melee or Brawl check, suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Frenzied Attack to upgrade the ability of the attack by an equal number.
frenziedAttack.name: Frenzied Attack

fullStop.description: When piloting a ship or vehicle, you may take a Full Stop maneuver to reduce speed to 0 and suffer system strain equal to the amount the speed was reduced
fullStop.name: Full Stop

fullThrottle.description: Take a Full Throttle action; Make a Hard (3) Piloting check to increase a vehicles top speed by 1 for a number of rounds equal to Cunning.
fullThrottle.name: Full Throttle

galaxyMapper.description: Remove 1 Setback 1 per rank of Galaxy Mapper from Astrogation Checks. Astrogation checks take half the normal time.
galaxyMapper.name: Galaxy Mapper

gearhead.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Gearhead from all Mechanics checks. Halve the credit cost to add mods to attachments
gearhead.name: Gearhead

goodCop.description: You may spend 2 Advantage from a Charm or Negotiation check to upgrade the ability of an ally's subsequent social interaction against that target a number of times equal to ranks in Good Cop
goodCop.name: Good Cop

greasedPalms.description: Before making a social check, you may spend up to 50 credits per ranks of Greased Palms to upgrade the ability of the check once for every 50 credits spent
greasedPalms.name: Greased Palms

hardHeaded.description: When staggered or disoriented, perform the Hard Headed action; make a Daunting (4) Discipline check to remove that status. Reduce the difficulty of the skill check by ranks of Hard Headed
hardHeaded.name: Hard Headed

heavyHitter.description: Once per session, you may spend 1 Triumph on a successful Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery check to add the Breach 1 quality to the attack, or increase an existing Breach rating by 1
heavyHitter.name: Heavy Hitter

heightenedAwareness.description: Allies within short range add 1 Boost to Perception or Vigilance checks. Engaged Allies add 2 Boost.
heightenedAwareness.name: Heightened Awareness

heroicFortitude.description: You may spend 1 Destiny point to ignore the effects of Critical Injuries on Brawn or Agility checks until the end of the encounter
heroicFortitude.name: Heroic Fortitude

heroicResilience.description: Immediately after being hit by an attack, but before suffering damage, spend 1 Destiny Point to increase soak by ranks in Resilience
heroicResilience.name: Heroic Resilience

hiddenStorage.description: Gain a hidden storage in a vehicle or equipment that holds items with total encumbrance equal to ranks in Hidden Storage
hiddenStorage.name: Hidden Storage

highGTraining.description: When a starship or vehicle being piloted would suffer system strain, you may suffer strain up to ranks in High-G Training to prevent an equal amount of System Strain
highGTraining.name: High-G Training

holdTogether.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Hold Together incidental immediately after a vehicle or starship takes damage to turn it into system strain.
holdTogether.name: Hold Together

hunter.description: Add 1 boost die per rank of Hunter to all checks when interacting with beasts or animals (including combat checks). Add +10 to Critical Injury results against beasts or animals per rank of Hunter.
hunter.name: Hunter

improvedArmorMaster.description: When wearing armor with a soak value of 2 or higher, increase defense by 1
improvedArmorMaster.name: Improved Armor Master

improvedBodyGuard.description: Once per session, when an ally protected by the Body Guard maneuver suffers a hit, you suffer the hit instead.
improvedBodyGuard.name: Improved Body Guard

improvedCommandingPresence.description: Once per session, you may take a Commanding Presence action; Make an opposed Cool vs Discipline check to force the target to leave the encounter.
improvedCommandingPresence.name: Improved Commanding Presence

improvedComradesInArms.description: Spend 3 Advantage, or 1 Triumph from Comrades In Arms to also gain +1 soak, and give 1 affected ally +1 soak
improvedComradesInArms.name: Improved Comrades In Arms

improvedConfidence.description: You may spend 1 Triumph on Fear checks to give allies in short range 1 Success on the same fear check.
improvedConfidence.name: Improved Confidence

improvedCorellianSendoff.description: When performing a Corellian Sendoff, the targets suffer a major collision instead of a minor collision.
improvedCorellianSendoff.name: Improved Corellian Sendoff

improvedDeadToRights.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to Agility to one hit of a successful attack made with ship or vehicle mounted weaponry
improvedDeadToRights.name: Improved Dead To Rights

improvedDefenses.description: You may make an Average (2) Survival check to fashion small defenses. It provides cover for up to 4 characters for the rest of that encounter.
improvedDefenses.name: Improved Defenses

improvedDefensiveSlicing.description: Defensive Slicing now upgrades opponents difficulty once per rank of Defensive Slicing, instead of adding Setback
improvedDefensiveSlicing.name: Improved Defensive Slicing

improvedFieldCommander.description: The Field Commander action affects allies equal to double your Presence, and you may spend 1 Triumph to allow allies to suffer 1 strain to perform 1 free action instead.
improvedFieldCommander.name: Improved Field Commander

improvedFormationTactics.description: The difficulty of Formation Tactics is reduced to Average (2). You may spend 1 Triumph, or 6 Advantage, to have the effect persist until the end of the encounter.
improvedFormationTactics.name: Improved Formation Tactics

improvedFullThrottle.description: Suffer 1 strain to attempt Full Throttle as a maneuver and decrease its difficulty to Average (2)
improvedFullThrottle.name: Improved Full Throttle

improvedHardHeaded.description: When incapacitated due to strain exceeding your threshold, you may take a Formidable (5) Hard Headed action to reduce strain to 1 below your threshold.
improvedHardHeaded.name: Improved Hard Headed

improvedHiddenStorage.description: You may use Hidden Storage to store an item within your own suitably modified body (Such as Cybernetics, Surgery, or Prosthetics)
improvedHiddenStorage.name: Improved Hidden Storage

improvedInTheKnow.description: Once per session, you may make an opposed Deception vs Vigilance check, with the difficulty downgraded once per rank of In The Know to have a target NPC believe specific false intelligence
improvedInTheKnow.name: Improved In The Know

improvedIndistinguishable.description: You may extend the effects of Indistinguishable to a number of allies within short range equal to ranks in Deception
improvedIndistinguishable.name: Improved Indistinguishable

improvedInspiringRhetoric.description: Each Ally affected by Inspiring Rhetoric gains 1 Boost die on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to your ranks in Leadership.
improvedInspiringRhetoric.name: Improved Inspiring Rhetoric

improvedKnowTheirWeakness.description: You may extend the effects of Know Their Weakness to a number of enemies within short range equal to your Presence Rating
improvedKnowTheirWeakness.name: Improved Know Their Weakness

improvedPlausibleDeniability.description: You may take an Improved Plausible Deniability action; Make a Hard (3) Coercion check to convince 1 bystander per ranks in Plausible Deniability to leave quietly
improvedPlausibleDeniability.name: Improved Plausible Deniability

improvedPosition.description: You may make a Hard (3) Mechanics check to construct a secure position. This provides cover for the group, and its vehicles.
improvedPosition.name: Improved Position

improvedPositiveSpin.description: Once per session, if no PCs Duty triggered, you may make a Daunting (4) Charm check, reducing the difficulty once per rank of Positive Spin, to trigger a PCs Duty
improvedPositiveSpin.name: Improved Positive Spin

improvedPrideAndJoy.description: While inside your Pride And Joy, recover 1 additional Strain when recovering strain, and spend 1 Advantage on checks made to recover Strain to also allow an ally within the vessel to recover 1 strain.
improvedPrideAndJoy.name: Improved Pride And Joy

improvedReadyForAnything.description: When making Cool or Vigilance checks to determine Initiative, you may spend 1 Triumph to add 1 Success per rank of Ready For Anything
improvedReadyForAnything.name: Improved Ready For Anything

improvedResearcher.description: On a successful Knowledge check, you and your allies gain 1 Advantage per rank of Researcher on checks to act on those facts until the end of your next turn.
improvedResearcher.name: Improved Researcher

improvedResistQuestioning.description: When 1 ally withing short range is targeted by an opposed social check, you may perform Resist Questioning to affect their check instead.
improvedResistQuestioning.name: Improved Resist Questioning

improvedScathingTirade.description: Each Enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers 1 Setback die on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to your ranks in Coercion.
improvedScathingTirade.name: Improved Scathing Tirade

improvedSecretsOfTheJedi.description: Discipline becomes a career skill. Secrets Of The Jedi may also be used when installing mods onto Lightsabers
improvedSecretsOfTheJedi.name: Improved Secrets Of The Jedi

improvedSpur.description: Suffer 1 Strain to attempt Spur as a maneuver, and decrease it's difficulty to Average (2)
improvedSpur.name: Improved Spur

improvedStimApplication.description: When performing the Stim Application action, you may increase the difficulty to Hard (3), and the target only suffers 1 strain (rather than the normal 4).
improvedStimApplication.name: Improved Stim Application

improvedStunningBlow.description: When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, you may spend 1 Triumph to stagger the target for 1 round. You can do this multiple times.
improvedStunningBlow.name: Improved Stunning Blow

improvedTimeToGo.description: When activating Time To Go, allow 1 engaged ally to also perform Time To Go (without spending an extra Destiny Point)
improvedTimeToGo.name: Improved Time To Go

improvisedDetonation.description: Once per session, you make make a Hard (3) Mechanics check to perform the Improvised Detonation action and build an explosive device, dealing damage equal to ranks in Intellect + ranks in Mechanics + Success.
improvisedDetonation.name: Improvised Detonation

inTheKnow.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of In The Know from checks to get information from people or disseminate news. Minion NPCs do not realize your allegiance.
inTheKnow.name: In The Know

inciteDistraction.description: While in a crowd, you may perform the Incite Distraction action; Make an Average (2) Deception check. If successful, enemies treat the area as difficult terrain. You may spend 1 Triumph to make the location impassable terrain to them instead
inciteDistraction.name: Incite Distraction

inciteRebellion.description: Once per session, you may take an Incite Rebellion action; Make a Hard (3) Coercion check to cause a number of beings up to ranks in Coercion to become rebellious until the end of the encounter
inciteRebellion.name: Incite Rebellion

indistinguishable.description: Upgrade the difficulty of all checks to identify you once per rank of Indistinguishable.
indistinguishable.name: Indistinguishable

informant.description: Once per session, you may reveal a contact who can shed light on a chosen subject.
informant.name: Informant

insideKnowledge.description: Once per session, while in an enemy facility or vessel, you may perform the Inside Knowledge action; Make a Hard (3) Skulduggery check. You may then find a single personal scale item with a rarity no greater than your Cunning + 2 that was previously stashed here, or gain a narrative benefit
insideKnowledge.name: Inside Knowledge

insidePerson.description: Once per session, you may spend a Destiny Point to establish you have been undercover in an identified enemy base or large vehicle. For the remainder of the session, add 2 Advantage to all checks you or your allies make that are associated with that location
insidePerson.name: Inside Person

inspiringLeadership.description: Take an Inspiring Leadership action; Make an Average (2) Leadership check. If successful, a number of allies up to your Presence rating within short range add 1 Success to their next skill check
inspiringLeadership.name: Inspiring Leadership

inspiringRhetoric.description: Take the Inspiring Rhetoric action; Make an Average (2) Leadership check. Each uncancelled Success causes 1 ally in short range to recover 1 strain. Spend 1 Advantage to cause 1 affected ally to recover 1 additional strain.
inspiringRhetoric.name: Inspiring Rhetoric

intenseFocus.description: Perform an Intense Focus maneuver; suffer 1 strain and upgrade the ability of your next skill check once.
intenseFocus.name: Intense Focus

intensePresence.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to your Presence rating.
intensePresence.name: Intense Presence

interjection.description: After another character makes a social check, suffer 3 strain to take an Interjection incidental; Make an Average (2) Vigilance check to add Success or Failure equal to Success, and Advantage or Threat equal to Advantage, to the other character's check
interjection.name: Interjection

intimidating.description: You may suffer a number of strain up to your ranks in Intimidating to downgrade the difficulty of Coercion Checks, or upgrade the difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks by that amount.
intimidating.name: Intimidating

inventor.description: When constructing new items or modifying attachments, add 1 Boost or remove 1 Setback per rank of Inventor
inventor.name: Inventor

itsNotThatBad.description: Once per session, when an ally would suffer a Critical Injury, you may take an It's Not That Bad action; Make a Hard (3) Medicine check to stop the ally from gaining the Critical Injury
itsNotThatBad.name: It's Not That Bad

jumpUp.description: When targeted by a combat check, you may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than your ranks in Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number
jumpUp.name: Jump Up

juryRigged.description: Choose 1 weapon, armor, or other item, and give it a permanent improvement while it remains in use. See EotE Core Page 138 for improvement details
juryRigged.name: Jury Rigged

killWithKindness.description: Remove 1 setback per rank of Kill With Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks
killWithKindness.name: Kill With Kindness

knockdown.description: After hitting with a melee attack, you may spend 1 Triumph to knock the target prone
knockdown.name: Knockdown

knowItAll.description: Once per session, you may perfectly recall an important fact previously learned as if a Destiny Point had been spent.
knowItAll.name: Know-It-All

knowSomebody.description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody
knowSomebody.name: Know Somebody

knowTheEnemy.description: You may use Knowledge (Warfare) when making checks to determine initiative
knowTheEnemy.name: Know The Enemy

knowTheRopes.description: Add 1 Boost to checks made to escape from restraints equal to ranks in Knowledge (Underworld). Spend 1 Triumph to free all other allies within short range
knowTheRopes.name: Know The Ropes

knowTheirWeakness.description: Once per session, you may perform the Know Their Weakness action; Choose 1 target in close range; Make a Hard (3) Perception check to downgrade the difficulty of social checks against that target once per rank of Know Their Weakness until the end of the session
knowTheirWeakness.name: Know Their Weakness

knowledgeSpecialization.description: When acquired, choose 1 Knowledge Skill. When making a skill check using the chosen skill, you may spend 1 Triumph to gain additional successes equal to ranks in Knowledge Specialization.
knowledgeSpecialization.name: Knowledge Specialization

knownSchematic.description: Once per session, you may perform a Known Schematic maneuver; Make a Hard (3) Knowledge (Education) check to get familiarity with a building or ships design
knownSchematic.name: Known Schematic

koiogranTurn.description: When an opponent has gained the advantage on a starship or vehicle being piloted, you may perform the Koiogran Turn maneuver to remove the effects.
koiogranTurn.name: Koiogran Turn

largerProject.description: Signature Vehicles can have a silhouette of 1 larger per rank of Larger Project
largerProject.name: Larger Project

lethalBlows.description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents
lethalBlows.name: Lethal Blows

letsRide.description: Once per round, you may mount or dismount a vehicle or beast, or enter a cockpit or weapon station on a vehicle, as an incidental.
letsRide.name: Let's Ride

loseThem.description: When being followed or chased, you may perform a Lose Them action; make a Hard (3) Stealth check. If successful, add 2 Setback to all checks to follow you for the remainder of the encounter. You may spend 1 Triumph to have your pursuers lose you completely
loseThem.name: Lose Them

machineMender.description: When making a Mechanics check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Machine Mender
machineMender.name: Machine Mender

madeYouTalk.description: Once per session, you may make an opposed social skill check against a captured enemy character within short range and add 1 Boost for every 2 Strain inflicted on the target that encounter. If successful, your party gains a bonus based on the enemy NPC type
madeYouTalk.name: Made You Talk

masterArtisan.description: Once per round, you may take the Master Artisan incidental. Suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Mechanics check by 1, to a minimum of Easy (1)
masterArtisan.name: Master Artisan

masterDemolitionist.description: When resolving an attack from a personal explosive or ordnance weapon, you may spend 1 Advantage or Triumph to have the weapons Blast quality act at short range, or medium range if it already acts at short.
masterDemolitionist.name: Master Demolitionist

masterDoctor.description: Once per round, you may suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of a Medicine check by 1.
masterDoctor.name: Master Doctor

masterDriver.description: Once per round, while driving a vehicle, you may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver
masterDriver.name: Master Driver

masterGrenadier.description: Decrease the Advantage cost to activate the Blast quality of any weapon used by 1, to a minimum of 1 Advantage
masterGrenadier.name: Master Grenadier

masterInstructor.description: Once per round, as an out of turn incidental, you may suffer 2 strain to allow allies to use your ranks in Discipline for the next Discipline they make.
masterInstructor.name: Master Instructor

masterLeader.description: Once per round, you may suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Leadership check by 1, to a minimum of Easy (1)
masterLeader.name: Master Leader

masterMerchant.description: When buying or selling goods, or paying off or taking Obligation, you may suffer 2 strain to sell for 25% more, buy for 25% less, pay off 1 more Obligation, or take 1 less.
masterMerchant.name: Master Merchant

masterOfShadows.description: Once per round, you may suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Stealth or Skulduggery check by 1
masterOfShadows.name: Master Of Shadows

masterPilot.description: Once per round, when piloting a starship, you may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver.
masterPilot.name: Master Pilot

masterSlicer.description: Once per round, you may make a Master Slicer incidental to suffer 2 strain and decrease the difficulty of the next Computers or other slicing checks by 1, to a minimum of Easy (1)
masterSlicer.name: Master Slicer

masterStarhopper.description: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Astrogation check by 1 to a minimum of Easy (1)
masterStarhopper.name: Master Starhopper

masterStrategist.description: Once per phase during Mass Combat, you may suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of a Mass Combat check once.
masterStrategist.name: Master Strategist

mentalFortress.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore the effects of Critical Injuries on Intellect or Cunning skill checks until the end of the encounter
mentalFortress.name: Mental Fortress

mostImpressive.description: You may spend 1 Triumph from any skill check to allow a number of allies up to your Presence Rating within short range to add 1 Advantage to their next check
mostImpressive.name: Most Impressive

movingTarget.description: If you have already acted this round, increase your Ranged Defense by 1 per rank of Moving Target
movingTarget.name: Moving Target

naturalAthlete.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Athletics or Coordination check
naturalAthlete.name: Natural Athlete

naturalBrawler.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Brawl or Melee check.
naturalBrawler.name: Natural Brawler

naturalCharmer.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Charm or Deception Check.
naturalCharmer.name: Natural Charmer

naturalDoctor.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Medicine Check
naturalDoctor.name: Natural Doctor

naturalDriver.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Piloting (Planetary) or Gunnery check
naturalDriver.name: Natural Driver

naturalEnforcer.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Coercion or Streetwise check
naturalEnforcer.name: Natural Enforcer

naturalHunter.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Perception or Vigilance check
naturalHunter.name: Natural Hunter

naturalInstructor.description: Once per session you may re-roll any 1 Discipline or Leadership check.
naturalInstructor.name: Natural Instructor

naturalLeader.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Cool or Leadership check
naturalLeader.name: Natural Leader

naturalMarksman.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Ranged (Light) or (Heavy) check.
naturalMarksman.name: Natural Marksman

naturalNegotiator.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Cool or Negotiation check.
naturalNegotiator.name: Natural Negotiator

naturalOutdoorsman.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Resilience or Survival check
naturalOutdoorsman.name: Natural Outdoorsman

naturalPilot.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check
naturalPilot.name: Natural Pilot

naturalProgrammer.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Computers or Astrogation check.
naturalProgrammer.name: Natural Programmer

naturalRogue.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Skulduggery or Stealth check
naturalRogue.name: Natural Rogue

naturalScholar.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Knowledge skill check.
naturalScholar.name: Natural Scholar

naturalTinkerer.description: Once per session, you may re-roll any 1 Mechanics check
naturalTinkerer.name: Natural Tinkerer

nobodysFool.description: You may upgrade the difficulty of all incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.
nobodysFool.name: Nobody's Fool

notToday.description: Once per session, you may spend 1 Destiny Point to save your Signature Vehicle from destruction.
notToday.name: Not Today

oneWithNature.description: When in the wilderness, you may make a Simple Survival check to recover strain at the end of the encounter.
oneWithNature.name: One With Nature

outdoorsman.description: Remove 1 setback die per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrainor manage environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by half.
outdoorsman.name: Outdoorsman

overstockedAmmo.description: Increase the value of the Limited Ammo quality of any weapons mounted on your Signature Vehicle by 1 per rank of Overstocked Ammo
overstockedAmmo.name: Overstocked Ammo

overwhelmDefenses.description: Upon an unsuccessful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, you may spend 2 Advantage per rank of Overwhelm Defenses. Reduce the defense of the targeted zone by 1 for every 2 Advantage spent
overwhelmDefenses.name: Overwhelm Defenses

parry.description: When hit by a Melee attack, you may suffer 3 strain to reduce the damage by 2 + ranks in Parry
parry.name: Parry

persistentTargeting.description: After making one of more successful combat checks, add 1 Boost die to combat checks against that same target for the remainder of the encounter
persistentTargeting.name: Persistent Targeting

physicalTraining.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Physical Training to all Athletics and Resilience checks
physicalTraining.name: Physical Training

plausibleDeniability.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Plausible Deniability from all Coercion and Deception checks.
plausibleDeniability.name: Plausible Deniability

pointBlank.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of 1 hit of a successful Ranged (Heavy) or (Light) attack made while at close or engaged range.
pointBlank.name: Point Blank

positiveSpin.description: Whenever any character's Duty would increase, it increases by an additional 1 per rank of Positive Spin
positiveSpin.name: Positive Spin

powerfulBlast.description: Increase Blast damage dealt by explosives, explosive weapons, and grenades, by 1 per rank of Powerful Blast
powerfulBlast.name: Powerful Blast

preciseAim.description: Add 1 boost die per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks
preciseAim.name: Precise Aim

precisionStrike.description: When this character inflicts a Critical Injury with a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber weapon, you may suffer 1 strain to change the result to any Easy (1) Critical Injury
precisionStrike.name: Precision Strike

prepareToBeBoarded.description: Once per encounter, you may take a Prepare To Board! action; Make an opposed Coercion vs Discipline check against the enemy ships captain. If successful, the enemy captain suffers 1 strain per uncancelled Success, and surrenders the ship if they exceed the strain threshold. You may also use 1 Triumph, or 3 Advantage, to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coercion
prepareToBeBoarded.name: Prepare To Be Boarded!

pressurePoint.description: When making a Brawl check against an opponent, instead of dealing regular damage, you may deal that damage as strain, plus additional strain damage equal to your ranks in Medicine
pressurePoint.name: Pressure Point

preyOnTheWeak.description: Add +1 damage to one hit of a successful combat check against disoriented targets per rank of Prey On The Weak
preyOnTheWeak.name: Prey On The Weak

prideAndJoy.description: Choose 1 starship or vehicle you own with a silhouette of 4 or more. it becomes your "Pride And Joy". Upgrasde the ability of all social checks made within short range of the vehicle once
prideAndJoy.name: Pride And Joy

primePositions.description: When this character, or an ally in short range, takes cover, increase their soak against ranged attacks by 1 per rank of Prime Positions until they leave that cover.
primePositions.name: Prime Positions

pushAside.description: After making a successful Melee, Brawl, or Lightsaber combat check against an engaged foe, you may force the target to move to short range in the direction of their choosing. You can spend 1 Triumph to have the target fall prone after moving
pushAside.name: Push Aside

pushTheSpecs.description: You may perform the Push The Specs action when in a starship or vehicle; Make an Average (2) Knowledge (Education) check. With success, the ships top speed increases by 1 for a number of rounds equal to your Intellect
pushTheSpecs.name: Push The Specs

quickDraw.description: Once per round, you can draw or holster a weapon or accessible item as an incidental
quickDraw.name: Quick Draw

quickFix.description: Once per session, you make make 1 skill check using Agility, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill
quickFix.name: Quick Fix

quickStrike.description: Add 1 boost die per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against targets that have not acted yet this encounter
quickStrike.name: Quick Strike

rainOfDeath.description: Perform the Rain Of Death maneuver to ignore the increased difficulty of the Auto-Fire quality of attacks made this turn.
rainOfDeath.name: Rain Of Death

rapidReaction.description: Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Rapid Reaction to add an equal number of Successes to an Initiative check.
rapidReaction.name: Rapid Reaction

rapidRecovery.description: When healing strain after an encounter, heal 1 additional strain per rank of Rapid Recovery
rapidRecovery.name: Rapid Recovery

readyForAnything.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Ready For Anything on Mass Combat checks to determine initiative order
readyForAnything.name: Ready For Anything

redundantSystems.description: Once per session, you may take a Redundant Systems action; Make an Easy (1) Mechanics check to harvest components from a functioning device to repair a broken one without breaking the first device.
redundantSystems.name: Redundant Systems

reflect.description: When hit by a ranged attack, you may suffer 3 strain to reduce the damage by 2 + ranks in Reflect
reflect.name: Reflect

reinforcedFrame.description: Your Signature Vehicle gains Massive 1L When making an attack targeting this ship or vehicle, the Critical rating of the weapon used counts as 1 higher
reinforcedFrame.name: Reinforced Frame

repairPackSpecialization.description: Whenever using an emergency repair patch, the target heals an additional wound per rank of Repair Patch Specialization.
repairPackSpecialization.name: Repair Pack Specialization

rerouteProcessors.description: Once per encounter, you may take a Reroute Processors action; Make an Average (2) Computers check to reduce one of a droids characteristics by 1, and increase another of its characteristics by 1.
rerouteProcessors.name: Reroute Processors

researcher.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Researcher from all Knowledge Checks. Researching a subject takes half the time.
researcher.name: Researcher

resistQuestioning.description: When targeted by an opposed social check, you may suffer 2 strain to perform the Resist Questioning incidental, adding 1 Setback to the check. If the check fails, you may spend 1 Despair to indicate you have provided false information to the foe
resistQuestioning.name: Resist Questioning

resolve.description: When you would involuntarily suffer strain, you suffer 1 less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of 1.
resolve.name: Resolve

respectedScholar.description: May downgrade the difficulty of checks to interact with institutes of learning by 1 level per rank of Respected Scholar
respectedScholar.name: Respected Scholar

scathingTirade.description: Take a Scathing Tirade action; make an Average (2) Coercion check. Each uncancelled Success causes 1 enemy in short range to suffer 1 strain. Spend 1 advantage to cause 1 affected enemy to suffer an additional strain.
scathingTirade.name: Scathing Tirade

secondChances.description: Once per encounter, you may choose a number of positive dice equal to ranks in Second Chances, and re-roll them
secondChances.name: Second Chances

secondWind.description: Once per encounter, you may use a Second Wind incidental to heal strain equal to ranks in Second Wind.
secondWind.name: Second Wind
